org.jpac
Class Fireable

java.lang.Object
  org.jpac.Fireable
Direct Known Subclasses:
ProcessEvent
public abstract class Fireable
extends java.lang.Object

base class of all event, which might occur during the life time of an elbfisch application

Method Detail

initStates

protected void initStates()

fire

public abstract boolean fire()
                      throws ProcessException
must be implemented by the application programmer. Is called by jPac in every cycle to check, if the fire condition occured the fire condition must be true for at least one call. If it occurs it is latched by the Fireable, until it is processed. Must not be called by the application directly.

Returns:
true, if the fire condition occured
Throws:
ProcessException - if the application code produces an process exception. It is passed onto the awaiting module.

isFired

public boolean isFired()
                throws ProcessException
used to check, if a fireable has been fired. Keeps it state, until reset() is called.

Returns:
true: the Fireable has been fired
Throws:
ProcessException

notifyObservingModule

public void notifyObservingModule()

register

public void register()

unregister

public void unregister()

reset

public void reset()
used to reset the Fireable to its initial state.

monitor

public void monitor()
             throws InconsistencyException
used to set a monitor on a Fireable. If it is fired, a MonitorException is thrown to the monitoring module

Throws:
InconsistencyException - thrown, if an jpac internal problem arose

unmonitor

public void unmonitor()
used to reset a monitor on a Fireable.
